q: Who was the first Portuguese to arrive in India?
desc: Vasco-da-Gama reached Calicut in 1498 during the reign of the Hindu ruler Zamorin.

q: In which year did Vasco-da-Gama reach Calicut?
desc: Vasco-da-Gama reached the port of Calicut in 1498.

q: Who was the ruler of Calicut when Vasco-da-Gama arrived?
desc: Zamorin was the Hindu ruler of Calicut during Vasco-da-Gama's arrival.

q: Which Portuguese governor captured Goa in 1510?
desc: Alfonso de Albuquerque captured Goa in AD 1510.

q: Who was the first Governor of Portuguese India?
desc: Francisco de Almeida was the first Portuguese Governor of India.

q: Which of these was not a Portuguese settlement?
desc: Madurai was not among the Portuguese settlements.

q: When was the Dutch East India Company formed?
desc: The Dutch East India Company was formed in AD 1602.

q: Where did the Dutch establish their first factory in India?
desc: The Dutch established their first factory at Masulipatnam in 1605.

q: Which battle marked the decline of Dutch power in India?
desc: The Dutch were defeated by the English at the Battle of Bedara in 1759.

q: After the Battle of Bedara, the Dutch focused on which region?
desc: Post-Battle of Bedara, Dutch gained control over Indonesia.

q: When was the English East India Company formed?
desc: The English East India Company was formed in 1599.

q: Which Englishman received a farman from Jahangir in 1613?
desc: Captain William Hawkins received permission to erect a factory at Surat in 1613.

q: Who got an imperial farman from Jahangir in 1615?
desc: Sir Thomas Roe secured an imperial farman in 1615 to trade throughout the Mughal Empire.

q: Who is credited with founding the city of Calcutta?
desc: Job Charnock founded Calcutta in 1698 after acquiring the zamindari of three villages.

q: Which year marks the foundation of Calcutta?
desc: Calcutta was founded in 1698 by Job Charnock.

q: Which fort was built in Calcutta in 1700?
desc: Fort William was set up in Calcutta in 1700.

q: Who obtained a farman from Farrukhsiyar in 1717?
desc: John Surman secured a farman from Mughal emperor Farrukhsiyar in 1717.

q: What document is considered the Magna Carta of the English Company?
desc: The farman from Farrukhsiyar in 1717 is called the Magna Carta of the Company.

q: Which of these was NOT a Dutch factory in India?
desc: Lucknow was not among the Dutch trading posts.

q: Which city near Madras was a Portuguese settlement?
desc: San Thome, near Madras, was a Portuguese settlement.

q: Which company was granted a charter by Queen Elizabeth in 1600?
desc: Queen Elizabeth granted a charter to the English East India Company in 1600.

q: Which was NOT a Portuguese factory?
desc: Calcutta was founded by the English, not the Portuguese.

q: Which of the following was a Dutch factory?
desc: Karaikal was one of the Dutch factories.

q: What did the Dutch lose to the British after the Battle of Bedara?
desc: Post-defeat at Bedara, the Dutch lost India to the British.

q: What was founded on the zamindari of Suttanati, Kalikata, and Govindpur?
desc: The city of Calcutta was founded after acquiring these three villages.

q: When was Fort William established?
desc: Fort William was set up in Calcutta in 1700.

q: Which Mughal emperor granted the 1717 farman?
desc: Farrukhsiyar granted the 1717 farman to the English.

q: Which city did the English establish their first factory in?
desc: The first English factory was established in Surat in 1613.

q: Who gave permission to the English to trade throughout the Mughal Empire?
desc: Jahangir allowed English trade in all parts of the Mughal Empire.

q: In which year did the Battle of Plassey take place?
desc: The Battle of Plassey was fought in 1757.

q: Who was defeated by the English in the Battle of Plassey?
desc: Sirajuddaula, the Nawab of Bengal, was defeated in the Battle of Plassey.

q: The Battle of Buxar was fought in which year?
desc: The Battle of Buxar took place in 1764.

q: Who led the English forces in the Battle of Buxar?
desc: Captain Munro led the English forces in the Battle of Buxar.

q: Which of the following was NOT a participant in the Battle of Buxar?
desc: Sirajuddaula was defeated earlier in the Battle of Plassey and was not part of the Battle of Buxar.

q: When was the Danish East India Company formed?
desc: The Danish East India Company was formed in 1616.

q: Where was the Danish colony Tranquebar located?
desc: Tranquebar was a Danish colony on the southern Coromandel coast in Tamil Nadu.

q: Which Danish settlement was located in Bengal?
desc: Serampur in Bengal was one of the main Danish settlements in India.

q: When did the Danes sell their Indian settlements to the English?
desc: The Danish sold their settlements to the English in 1845.

q: Who established the French East India Company?
desc: Colbert established the French East India Company under state patronage in 1664.

q: In which year was the French East India Company formed?
desc: The French East India Company was formed in 1664.

q: Who established the first French factory in India?
desc: Francois Caron established the first French factory at Surat in 1668.

q: Where was the first French factory in India established?
desc: The first French factory was established at Surat in 1668.

q: When did the French set up a factory at Masulipatnam?
desc: The French established a factory at Masulipatnam in 1669.

q: Which battle marked the decline of French power in India?
desc: The French were decisively defeated by the English in the Battle of Wandiwash in 1760.

q: Who won the Battle of Wandiwash?
desc: The English defeated the French in the Battle of Wandiwash in 1760.

q: Which of these battles took place in 1760?
desc: The Battle of Wandiwash was fought in 1760 between the English and the French.

q: Which European power had a colony at Tranquebar?
desc: Tranquebar on the Coromandel coast was a Danish colony.

q: Which two Danish settlements were sold to the English in 1845?
desc: The Danes sold Tranquebar and Serampur to the English in 1845.

q: Who among the following was NOT involved in the Battle of Buxar?
desc: Sirajuddaula was already defeated in the Battle of Plassey and did not participate in the Battle of Buxar.
